intro: Alfaroa guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan alfaroa, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of red and orange. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
